name: rocky mountain colourblock pullover
notes:
pdf digital download crochet pattern
english only - no refunds on digital products

the rocky mountain colourblock pullover is worked in one piece from the top-down in simple double crochet stitches, making it a great beginner sweater pattern. the pullover can easily be modified to any length, and the pattern works up quickly with no seaming. this cozy and modern sweater is crocheted in knit picks /wecrochet palette fingering weight yarn and includes a step-by-step tutorial for size small on youtube. 

difficulty: easy
written in standard american terms

yarn
palette fingering weight- 100% peruvian highland wool (231 yds/50g shown in oyster, brindle and asphalt heather
https://shrsl.com/3gj14
small size 2 oyster, 2 brindle and 3 asphalt - see the blog/chart for xs-5x

hook - use code mjs15 for 15% off
us 6/g (4mm)
us 7/g+ (4.5mm) or size needed to obtain gauge

materials -find them here https://amzn.to/3e5ngly
tapestry needle
stitch markers
scissors
measuring tape
steamer
woolwash - https://shrsl.com/3gp7x

gauge
20 sts and 10 rows equal to 4" in dc with 4.5mm hook
7 sts and 3 rows equal to 1" in ribbed pattern with 4mm hook

video link: https://youtu.be/3sw6o9flaso
